tool.name: FeatureFinderCentroided
tool.description: Detects two-dimensional features in LC-MS data.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $seeds: mkdir seeds && ln -s '$seeds' 'seeds/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $seeds.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($seeds.ext)' && #end if #if "out_mzq_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_mzq && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #if $seeds: -seeds 'seeds/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $seeds.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($seeds.ext)' #end if #if "out_mzq_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_mzq 'out_mzq/output.${gxy2omsext("mzq")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out' #if "out_mzq_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_mzq/output.${gxy2omsext("mzq")}' '$out_mzq' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: input file
User specified seed list
Pseudo RT shift used when

section.name: intensity
section.title: Settings for the calculation of a score indicating if a peak's intensity is significant in the local environment (between 0 and 1)

param.label: Number of bins per dimension (RT and m/z)
param.help: The higher this value, the more local the intensity significance score is.. This parameter should be decreased, if the algorithm is used on small regions of a map

section.name: mass_trace
section.title: Settings for the calculation of a score indicating if a peak is part of a mass trace (between 0 and 1)

param.label: Tolerated m/z deviation of peaks belonging to the same mass trace
param.help: It should be larger than the m/z resolution of the instrument.. This value must be smaller than that 1/charge_high!

param.label: Number of spectra that have to show a similar peak mass in a mass trace
Number of consecutive spectra where a high mass deviation or missing peak is acceptable
param.help: This parameter should be well below 'min_spectra'!

param.label: The maximum slope of mass trace intensities when extending from the highest peak
param.help: This parameter is important to separate overlapping elution peaks.. It should be increased if feature elution profiles fluctuate a lot

section.name: isotopic_pattern
section.title: Settings for the calculation of a score indicating if a peak is part of a isotopic pattern (between 0 and 1)

param.label: Lowest charge to search fo
Highest charge to search fo
Tolerated m/z deviation from the theoretical isotopic pattern
param.help: It should be larger than the m/z resolution of the instrument.. This value must be smaller than that 1/charge_high!

param.label: Isotopic peaks that contribute more than this percentage to the overall isotope pattern intensity must be present
Isotopic peaks that contribute more than this percentage to the overall isotope pattern intensity can be missing
Minimal percental improvement of isotope fit to allow leaving out an optional peak
Window width in Dalton for precalculation of estimated isotope distributions
Rel
param.help: abundance of the light carbon. Modify if labeled

param.label: Rel
param.help: abundance of the light nitrogen. Modify if labeled

section.name: seed
section.title: Settings that determine which peaks are considered a seed

param.label: Minimum seed score a peak has to reach to be used as seed
param.help: The seed score is the geometric mean of intensity score, mass trace score and isotope pattern score.. If your features show a large deviation from the averagene isotope distribution or from an gaussian elution profile, lower this score

param.label: Maximum number of iterations of the fit

section.name: feature
section.title: Settings for the features (intensity, quality assessment, ...)

param.label: Feature score threshold for a feature to be reported
param.help: The feature score is the geometric mean of the average relative deviation and the correlation between the model and the observed peaks

param.label: Minimum isotope fit of the feature before model fitting
Trace score threshold
param.help: Traces below this threshold are removed after the model fitting.. This parameter is important for features that overlap in m/z dimension

param.label: Minimum RT span in relation to extended area that has to remain after model fitting
Maximum RT span in relation to extended area that the model is allowed to have
Choose model used for RT profile fitting
param.help: If set to symmetric a gauss shape is used, in case of asymmetric an EGH shape is used

param.label: Maximum allowed intersection of features
The mass type that is reported for features
param.help: 'maximum' returns the m/z value of the highest mass trace.. 'average' returns the intensity-weighted average m/z value of all contained peaks.. 'monoisotopic' returns the monoisotopic m/z value derived from the fitted isotope model

param.label: Allowed RT deviation of seeds from the user-specified seed position
Allowed m/z deviation of seeds from the user-specified seed position
Overwrites 'seed:min_score' for user-specified seeds
param.help: The cutoff is typically a bit lower in this case

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_mzq
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_mzq_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

Detects two-dimensional features in LC-MS data.
